metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9933 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Stack consumption vulnerability in the gdImageFillToBorder function in gd.c in the GD Graphics Library (aka libgd) before 2.2.2, as used in PHP before 5.6.28 and 7.x before 7.0.13, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation violation) via a crafted imagefilltoborder call that triggers use of a negative color value.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9933` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgd-tools - 2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.6
libgd3 - 2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.6
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> php uses the system libgd2

criterions.comment: libgd2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.6').
